1611236743_1HyrFrFXUHZC58qLuFrjAXm2Jjkb3.body: I've seen this before. Means you either must restart the Zeronet server or obtain a new ZeroID (restarting several times to install properly). Reason? Near as I can tell, Millchan or ZeroNet has a posting limit per ID of 5GB. Once you exceed that - your content won't sign. Therefore it won't propagate either. Only signed postings propagate.

1611680008_1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCF.body: When you figure this out, please document and repost. I suspect many need help here.

1611606727_1LPWdVJ1GNU738u2VUkoZdw9B7u4V.body: Believe your effort is helping. Posting speeds dropped quite a bit after the election...but now are faster than they've ever been. Thanks!

> [patriotbase](#comment_3_139pHaxesZa11czwptXVY62ZrNWUh4NxRQ): I was thinking about having some stickers printed up: 'ZeroNet.io: Join the Free Speech Internet', or something along those lines.

I wish you luck - but shilling has been tried with Zeronet. Mostly a failure. Either they see the utility - or they don't. 

One thing which might help? Haven't seen anyone promote "infinite expandability" yet. To be fair, none of us really knows that yet. Not enough users to test. But there are hints this might be true. The underlying plumbing is sound. Zeronet by itself seems quite robust. Most of the problems have to do with inferior relays. And don't forget, every onion connection is 6 hops. Despite this, I've seen the durn thing move gigabytes very quickly. There is literally nothing better anywhere for distributing images and some video files.

1612184585_18yzU6FADirNEPhLVyRHBdnfVQaAT.body: Blah, blah, blah. I'd setup an onion node 24/7 if you guys would spare me the bitcoin blabber. Don't care about mining or the rest of that stuff. That's your real barrier to success.
